page.title: 01Eastcotts General Review
page.content: Situated about 2 miles S.E. of Bedford this block is covered predominently by agricultural land and apart from one or two farms, housing is only to be found in Cotton End, at the top N.E. corner, with a little residential accommodation just south of this in Herrings Green. It is virtually a suburb of Bedford with a population of around 1600. Cotton End has a Church, School, Post Office, Village Hall, W.I., and football team. The attractive countryside, mainly flat apart from a high ridge running across from N.E. to S.W., boasts a nature reserve and many lovely walks. Although not in the block the presence of adjacent R.A.F. Cardington, just north of Cotton End, is hard to escape. Its huge hangers and large silent airships overhang and dominate the landscape to the north.
